reviews.body:
**Actionable comments posted: 0**
üßπ Nitpick comments (2)
README_KO.md (2)
`1224-1224`: **Consistent Inference on Object with Optional Field** The change in `type C = z.infer;` clearly demonstrates how to extract the type from an object schema where a property is made optional. For improved clarity, you might consider renaming the inferred type (for example, to `UserType`), but as a documentation example this is acceptable. --- `1789-1789`: **Note on Intersection Type Inference** The change `type c = z.infer;` correctly infers the type (which, in this case, results in a `number`). One suggestion: since using the same identifier for both the variable and the inferred type (here "c") might be confusing, consider using a more descriptive name (for example, `type IntersectionResult = z.infer;`) in future documentation updates.
üìú Review details **Configuration used: CodeRabbit UI** **Review profile: CHILL** **Plan: Pro**
üì• Commits Reviewing files that changed from the base of the PR and between 850871defc2c98928f1c7e8e05e93d4a84ed3c5f and 1adcf72d8edd6ecc1de7828a03ed9085141b7da7.
üìí Files selected for processing (1) * `README_KO.md` (30 hunks)
üîá Additional comments (12)
README_KO.md (12) `652-652`: **Explicit Type Inference for User Schema** The update from an implicit `z.infer` to an explicit `z.infer` clarifies that the inferred type is directly tied to the `User` schema. This change meets the PR objective for enhanced clarity and type safety in documentation. --- `1068-1068`: **Explicit Type Inference for Date Schema** Changing the date schema‚Äôs type declaration to `type DateSchema = z.infer;` ensures that the inferred type is explicitly linked to `dateSchema`. This improves the example‚Äôs clarity and aligns with the documentation update goals. --- `1088-1088`: **Clarifying Inference for FishEnum** Updating the fish enum definition to `type FishEnum = z.infer;` makes the example explicit about the connection between the inferred type and its corresponding schema. This is consistent with the updated documentation standards. --- `1152-1152`: **Precise Inference for Native Enum (FruitEnum)** The modification to `type FruitEnum = z.infer;` provides an explicit link between the native enum schema and its inferred TypeScript type. This clear pattern enhances readability and correctness in the docs. --- `1215-1215`: **Explicit Inference for Optional Schema Example** Defining `type A = z.infer;` after declaring an optional string schema exactly shows that the inferred type includes¬†`undefined` (i.e. `string | undefined`). This explicitness is very helpful in documentation. --- `1270-1270`: **Inference of Object Schema (Dog)** By updating the extraction to `type Dog = z.infer;` the example follows the established pattern. This explicit extraction reinforces how to derive the type from the schema, which is especially useful for new users. --- `1320-1320`: **Explicit Inference in Merged Object Schema (Teacher)** The updated declaration `type Teacher = z.infer;` after merging object schemas clearly shows how the final inferred type includes properties from both merged schemas. This pattern is both informative and consistent. --- `1341-1341`: **Inference After Picking Object Properties** Changing the type extraction to `type JustTheName = z.infer;` demonstrates the proper extraction from a schema created by the `.pick()` method. This enhances readability and consistency throughout the docs. --- `1350-1350`: **Explicit Inference for Omitted Schema (NoIDRecipe)** The revised declaration `type NoIDRecipe = z.infer;` shows how to correctly infer the type from a schema that omits certain properties. This is a clear and useful update. --- `1601-1601`: **Clear Tuple Type Inference (Athlete)** By explicitly writing `type Athlete = z.infer;` the example now clearly shows how to extract the tuple type from the schema. This explicit approach greatly enhances clarity in documentation. --- `1740-1740`: **Explicit Inference for Map Schema** Updating the map schema type to `type StringNumberMap = z.infer;` explicitly communicates that the inferred type is a `Map`. This change is aligned with the new documentation guidelines. --- `1750-1750`: **Clear Inference for Set Schema** Changing to `type NumberSet = z.infer;` makes it explicit that the inferred type is a `Set`. This clear example enhances developer understanding.

**Actionable comments posted: 0**
üßπ Nitpick comments (1)
README.md (1)
`610-610`: **Capitalization and Punctuation Consistency** The new entry reads: `[‚Äòzod-csv‚Äô](https://github.com/bartoszgolebiowski/zod-csv): Validation helpers for zod for parsing CSV data.` For clarity and to match the rest of the README, please consider capitalizing ‚Äúzod‚Äù to ‚ÄúZod‚Äù (i.e. ‚ÄúValidation helpers for Zod for parsing CSV data.‚Äù). Also, verify that the trailing punctuation is consistent with the surrounding entries.
